p: The fat content (34.9%) was much higher than the average (13%) for orthopteran species (locust, crickets, grasshoppers) [ 5]. A study on adult L. migratoria conducted by Oonincx and van der Poel [ 7] did identify higher numbers (18.6% to 29.6%), with higher fat and lower protein contents acknowledged after wheat bran was added to their diet. Consequently, the grass and ground oat diet of the locusts in the current study would have impacted the protein and fat content found. Furthermore, the locusts were constantly active due to a constant artificial light source, and were domestically reared in incubated plastic boxes. This could alter the fat content identified, compared to literature that sourced insects from the wild [ 5].
